summary: "A guerrilla". I have not found a better word to describe my work and attitude as a Creative Director for both capitalist and worthy things over a period of more than a decade. I have relied on my ability to make use of whatever resources I have at hand and employ those in opposition to the ruling belief of how things ought to be done. With a solid strategy and open mind to people I have found inspiration in applying innovative means to challenge existing structures and conformity across a variety of categories including international companies on an Eastern European scale and have been blessed with assembling teams that follow me on this vision.

treasury_media.title: RENAULT – Tribute to Alpine F1
treasury_media.description: The history of Alpine in F1 is incredible – a journey of a black car that spans 44 years of selfless patience and devotion to its direct successor the famous Renault F1 team. This film is a celebration of the evolution of the sport and a tribute to Alpine's racing spirit, which contributed to historic victories for Renault. Mr. Alain Prost's voice brings the story full circle – this time a benevolent Renault passes the baton to Alpine providing engines for its long awaited first ever Grand Prix.

organizations.name: Investment and Development Agency of Latvia

projects.title: Ping Pong of Ideas Live on Latvijas Radio 1 (National Radio of Latvia)
projects.description:
A live radio show with Latvian celebrities sharing ideas for the celebration of the 100th anniversary of Latvia. The setting is a table tennis match where two teams take turns to develop their opponents suggestions on a broad range of topics.

Responsible for creation of the programme, fundraising, promotion and hosting of Season 1 in November, 2014. Since its launch the format is still on air with annual episodes for Season 2 in November, 2015 and Season 3 in November, 2016 respectively.

projects.title: BEAT Film Festival Rebranding for 2017
projects.description:
Beat Film Festival was launched in 2010 to screen music documentaries. Since then it has expanded not only the range of subjects it presents, but also the kind of people attending it. For this year's edition our task was to shift the perception of documentary films even further and provide them as a culturally relevant alternative to mainstream entertainment heavily consumed throughout Russia. It was decided to address this issue by using the festival's identity as key medium to promote the message in public.

We first chose to position the documentaries as real–life alternatives to Holywood blockbusters. We explored the subjects addressed during the festival and sourced the films for keywords that are highly relevant for contemporary Russian society. Combining these words into lists we made them resemble specific movie genres and disrupted the common style of using imagery in poster designs by opting for bold type instead. This style became the foundation of the new visual identity and language of communication.

Beat Film Festival was held in Moscow for the eight time this year and set a new record of participants. 20753 people attended screenings, discussions, Master Classes and after–parties. 15% more than 2016. Our approach was extended to merchandise and has since become collector's item for fashion and interior design.

Creative Director: Gatis Mūrnieks

projects.title: Olympic Apparel Design for the Latvian Olympic Team in Rio 2016

In Rio 2016 Summer Olympic Games the Latvian Olympic Team was introduced in a new apparel design. It was part of the visual identity symbolising the relentless spirit and enthusiasm of our athletes.

projects.title: Logo for the 100th Anniversary of Latvia
projects.description:
In 2018 Latvia will celebrate its 100th Anniversary. A sign was developed for the Ministry of Culture of Latvia to mark this occasion at home and across the globe.

profile_positions.title: Creative Director

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for PepsiCo brands (Pepsi, Lay's) in EER (Eastern Europe Region) countries.

Highlights:
-set up creative work on a regional scale including ideation workouts with Lay's EER brand teams
-presented all creative material on quarterly Pepsi conferences in Warsaw to all EER brand teams
-supervised multi-national teams from BBDO offices in Russia, Poland, Romania and Ukraine
-successfully proposed, tested and established new Pepsi brand platform for EER
-successfully tested and executed regional campaigns for Pepsi and Lay's in the EER
-compiled an international team (Latvians, Romanians, Brazilians, Russians) for the base office in Moscow
-actively participated in new talent search becoming a permanent member of the BBDO STARFORCE jury
-organised a series of lectures on "The Dark Side of Creativity" for the BBDO Russia Group staff

Responsible for creative strategy, leading multi-national teams (Russia, Poland, Romania, Ukraine) in concept development and supervising executions.
My other accounts have included:
Mobil1, Yandex, Hrusteam; most recently Pfizer and Adrenaline Rush (PepsiCo).
profile_positions.title: Creative Director

profile_positions.company: Latvijas Nacionālā bibliotēka / National Library of Latvia
profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the grand opening of the National Library of Latvia by appointment of the Minister of Culture of Latvia

Highlights:
-planned and executed the creative strategy for the opening of the new building "Castle of Light"
-raised more than 300K euros of funds to finance the opening programme and partnerships with media
-facilitated internal and external PR events during the transition to the new building
-compiled a creative team to carry out integrated marketing campaigns
-scripted and directed a 3 month long opening program consisting of an array of private and public events
-provided content and negotiated media partnerships with Public broadcasting of Latvia
-received honorary acknowledgement from Minister of Culture of Latvia for unselfish contribution

Responsible for creative strategy, fundraising, organising and directing the opening programme, creating and executing integrated marketing campaigns.
My other duties included:
content creation and partnership with leading media outlets, rights negotiations, volunteer recruitment.
profile_positions.title: Creative Director

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for management and creative leadership of McCANN WorldGroup Riga with its stake in seven other companies:
BrandBox (Design and Packaging), McCANN Social (Experiential), McCANN Digital, McCANN Consulting (PR & Lobbying), McCANN Live (In-house Production), Inspired Media, Inspired Digital (Social Media Agency).

Highlights:
-restructured agencies' business within the group to work to provide fully integrated services
-won seven new businesses in a row: Aldaris (Carlsberg), Borjomi (Georgian Mineral Water), Narvesen (Convenience), Ektornet (Real Estate), BWM, CSDD (Road Traffic Safety Directorate), Song and Dance Celebration by LNKC (Latvian National Centre for Culture)
-shifted drunk driving prevention campaigns from traditional media to online for the first time in history
-supervised the development of the brand platform for Tele2 (Telco) in Latvia which lasted four years
-facilitated the largest digital loyalty program to date for Swedbank – the leading private bank in Latvia
-made 48K logos by singing for a 140 year old tradition of Song and Dance Celebration in Riga
-improved agency income by 30% in second year to meet the projected revenue targets

My direct accounts as Executive Creative Director included:
Tele2 (Telco), Swedbank (Bank), BMW, CSDD (Road Traffic Safety Directorate), Song and Dance Celebration by LNKC (Latvian National Centre for Culture)
profile_positions.title: Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the creative supervision of communication at the XXV Song and XV Dance Celebration in Riga by appointment of the Minister of Culture of Latvia.

Highlights:
-produced 47K logos sung by 280K people of Latvia
-developed the long-term creative strategy and concept for the 2012-2018 period
-facilitated a holistic visual approach across all touchpoints including licenced and unlicenced parties 
-took on the public role of communicating on topics related to the Song and Dance Celebration brand 
-raised more than 800K euros of corporate funds to finance the preparation and production of the events
-successfully brought the Song and Dance Celebration on to social media (#dzsv) for the first time
-received honorary acknowledgement from the Prime Minister of Latvia for unselfish contribution

Responsible for creative vision of brand and communication, including creation of logo and visual identity, public relations and advocacy for digital.
profile_positions.title: Creative Director

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for creative strategy, concept development, leading teams and production supervision.

Highlights:
-changed the existing agency structure to deliver through-the-line marketing campaigns
-successfully relaunched OKarte brand from design, online and social to mainstream media and experiential
-prompted leading country officials (incl. the President) to comment our PR stunt for Ventspils Municipality
-received European Excellence awards for emitting our own currency for the Ventspils Municipality
-executed a successful series of hidden camera content with brand placement for Alfa Parks Shopping Mall
-introduced a "self-sufficient message" approach to brand and comms planning based on "0 media budget"
-DDB became the most awarded advertising agency in Latvia for its work on OKarte and Ventspils

My other accounts included:
Statoil, Alfa Parks (Retail), Grindex (Pharmacy)
profile_positions.title: Creative Director

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for art direction and mentoring new talent within the agency.

Highlights:
-developed the visual language "ПРОСТО" for internal relaunch of MTS brand values
-executed internal communication of the new brand platform "На шаг впереди"
-worked part-time with emerging creative talent from BBDO Wordshop

Responsible for creative concept development, crafting visual identity, supervising design work.
profile_positions.title: Art Director

profile_positions.description:
Co Founder of a Guerrilla Marketing Startup with Omnicom Media in Latvia.

Highlights:
-built the company on a freelance network providing unconventional creative services to media agencies
-in debut year won Silver Hammer for Best Use of TV and MTV Prize for Best Guerrilla at Golden Hammer
-a year later became Agency of the Year in Latvia
-won Best Campaign of the Year in 2010 for Aldaris (Carlsberg) at the ADCE Adwards Festival in Latvia
-pioneered numerous media firsts in the Baltic across BTL, Experiential, Digital, Social Media, Events and PR
-in three years produced 140 projects for more than 40 Baltic clients across a wide range of categories 
-gave regular lectures on "Guerrilla Marketing" at leading universities in the country (Stockholm School of Economics, University of Latvia, Ventspils University, Riga Stradiņš University, Latvian Academy of Culture a.o.)

Responsible for Creative Concepts, Art Direction, Copywriting, Design Supervision, Project Management, Production Supervision and working with freelancers.
My accounts included:
Unilever Baltic/Poland (AXE, Rexona, Lipton brands), Statoil, Laima (Orkla), Sony (Baltic), Linstow (Retail), Oriflame (Cosmetics), Maxima (Retail), Skandi Motors (Hyundai), Diena (Publishing), Ostby (Real Estate), Bite (Telco), LB (Spirits), Stockmann (Retail), Tieto (IT Services), Tele2 (Telco), FirstData (Finance), Escapelle (Pharma), Spice (Retail), Rimi (Retail), Merrild (FMCG), If... (Insurance), BMW, Nordea (Banking), BA Turība (Education) a.o.
profile_positions.title: Co Founder

company.name: Latvijas Nacionālā bibliotēka / National Library of Latvia

volunteer_experiences.description:
Pro-bono Creative Director for the National Library of Latvia by appointment of the Minister of Culture of Latvia.

Responsible for creative strategy, fundraising, organising and directing the opening programme, creating and executing integrated marketing campaigns.
My other duties included: content creation and partnership with leading media outlets, rights negotiations, volunteer recruitment.

A free course on "Guerrilla Marketing" for the Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.) program. A series of sixteen lectures covering the field of planning, ideation, management and execution of unconventional means of communication on low budgets for entrepreneurs and private business owners.

The attendance was record high ranging from 120-145 students at its peak. The course involved workshops and practical applications, including a flashmob in public space which drew social media attention and lead to the attendance of the leading local newspaper "Vents Balss" at the final lecture and resulting in a full page interview the following day on May 10th, 2011.
